oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Robin Beard and others on a parade float
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Photograph of Robin Beard in a chain link enclosure on the bed of a pickup truck. There is a sign that reads "Jail" attached to the front above Beard's head. Five other unidentified men stand around him, and one of them is holding a rifle. This enclosure was a float in the Mount Pleasant sesquicentennial parade. Robin Leo Beard Jr. (August 21, 1939 - June 16, 2007) was a Republican member of the United States House of Representatives from Tennessee's 6th congressional district, who served from 1973 to 1983.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Looking Back at Tennessee Photograph Collection, 1890-1981
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Floats (Parades); Men; Politicians
